page.title: 02The Trees of Ombersley Court
page.content: { Ombersley Court}is a magnificent private house that belongs to Lord and Lady Sandys. The court was built in the early 18th Century and the{grounds were landscaped in the first half of the 19th Century.Through the generations the Sandys family have been very interested in the planting of trees in the Estate.Visitors notice at once when they come into the parish of Ombersley, the abundance of well-grown trees.The trees need a lot of care and attention if they are to grow well. Some of the trees are particularly interesting.Their is a{Wellingtonia which was actually planted by the{Duke {of Wellington.}It took 13 children holding hands to fit round the girth. It is 124 feet high.Their is a {European Larch,}planted in 1738, which is 72ft tall and has a girth of 17ft.
